course_description: This course aims to build a solid foundation in finance theory and to expose doctoral students to topical areas in contemporary asset pricing research. The course has three main objectives: First, to study the theoretical foundations of modern Financial Economics. The course will cover many of the central themes of modern finance including individual investment decisions under uncertainty, theories of asset pricing and continuous time finance models. The second and third objectives are for students to develop quantitative skills and to learn to start thinking critically about the literature.
